page.title: 04FARMING - 1
page.content: Charlton Kings has both upland and lowland farms. Those on the hills, which are generally larger in size, have poorer soil with many limestone rocks. The valley farms have richer soils. Ham Hill Farm, an upland farm of 170 acres, has mainly pasture for beef cattle and sheep although 20 acres are laid down for winter feed. Favoured breeds are Hereford cattle and Scotch sheep half-bred with Suffolk rams. The farmer takes livestock to market in Gloucester. Coxhorne Farm, a valley farm, is 70 acres and primarily a dairy farm having Fresian, Guernsey/Hereford cross cattle. Milk is collected daily in a tanker and the farm is checked twice a year to guarantee milk quality. The milk from this farm is not turned into cheese or butter. They do not grow cereals.
